content:
• Wednesday, July 11, 2018
  • OCX

    OncoCyte gaining as Benchmark doubles price target

    • OncoCyte (NYSEMKT:OCX) is up 4.8% in thin late trading after Benchmark assumed coverage of the stock at Buy.
    • It's recouping some of today's decline (down 8.7% to $3.15).
    • Benchmark doubled its target to $7 from $3.50; that implies more than doubling from today's close of $3.15.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:51 PM
  • AVGO

    Broadcom confirms $18.9B buyout of CA

    • Broadcom (NASDAQ:AVGO) has sealed an $18.9B deal to acquire CA Technologies (NASDAQ:CA), even higher than an earlier report of $18B and signaling a heavy shift to enterprise software.
    • AVGO is down 5.8% postmarket; CA up 16.1%.
    • Broadcom expects the deal to close in Q4.
    • It says the transaction will push long-term adjusted EBITDA margins over 55% and be immediately accretive to EPS, and will provide for sustained double-digit compound annual growth in EPS.
    • CA shareholders will get $44.50/share in cash, about a 20% premium to today's close.
    • Broadcom will fund the deal with cash on hand and $18B in new fully committed debt; it expects to maintain investment grade rating due to cash flow and intent to quickly deleverage.
    • It will need CA shareholder approval as well as the regulatory OK from the U.S., EU and Japan.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:35 PM | 65 Comments
  • AGN

    Galmed +20% as Cantor sets Street-high target

    • Galmed Pharmaceuticals is a top mover after hours, up 20.4%, after Cantor Fitzgerald issued a new Street-high price target of $59.
    • That's vs. today's close of $10.55; average price target is around $35.67.
    • The company could be a leader in the space of nonalcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH), analyst Elemer Piros says.
    • The company is set to meet with the FDA in Q4 to talk about design of a Phase 3 trial after the Phase 2B "Arrest" trial came up positive. Of three meaningful NASH pivotal programs in development by Q4 (along with Allergan (NYSE:AGN) and Madrigal (NASDAQ:MDGL)), Galmed's in the best spot to achieve improvements on two distinct endpoints, Piros writes. (h/t Bloomberg)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:31 PM | 14 Comments
  • FPI

    Farmland Partners CEO disputes short seller allegations

    • Farmland Partners (NYSE:FPI) +4.9% after-hours following a 39% thrashing in regular trade sparked by a short seller's report that the REIT's loans to individuals associated with CEO Paul Pittman had introduced a "significant risk of insolvency."
    • Pittman tells Reuters that FPI had made loans to the people mentioned in the article as part of the company’s tenant loan program but had not “made any loans to related parties that are not appropriately disclosed.”
    • On the article’s assertion that FPI faces a “significant risk of insolvency," the CEO says “We’re not near insolvent. We're not overpaid. Our properties are valuable... Our rents are in fact going up.”
    • In a statement issued after the close, FPI denies that it failed to meet its responsibilities of fair and full disclosure and intentionally misled investors with its financial reporting.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:22 PM | 13 Comments
  • ZN

    Zion Oil & Gas -17% as SEC sends subpoena, opens investigation

    • Zion Oil & Gas (NASDAQ:ZN) -17.5% after-hours after disclosing it received a subpoena from the SEC to produce documents related to "a non-public, fact-finding inquiry into the company."
    • ZN says it had no previous knowledge of this specific investigation until it received the SEC subpoena on June 21.
    • "While we acknowledge that our response to the subpoena will necessarily entail significant costs and management's attention, it should have no effect on Zion's ongoing testing procedures on its Megiddo-Jezreel #1 well," ZN says.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:06 PM | 10 Comments
  • CA

    After Hours Gainers / Losers (07/11/2018)

    • Top gainers: CA +15.7%. WFT +5.7%. FPI +3.2%. BHGE +2.8%. AUPH +2.5%.
    • Top Losers: ACRX -9.0%.AVGO -5.6%.  OTCQB:MOMT -3.2%. HTGC -2.0%. AVDL -2.0%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM
  • OZK

    Bank of Ozark falls even as Q2 NII reaches record

    • Bank of the Ozarks (OZRK) fell 2.25% in after-hours trading as Q2 EPS matched consensus, and revenue missed.
    • Q2 net interest income was a record $224.7M, up 11% Y/Y.
    • Total loans, including purchased loans, $16.8B at June 30, 2018, up 10% from a year ago.
    • Non-purchased loans--in other words loans that weren't acquired through acquisitions--were $14.2B at the end of Q2, up 29% Y/Y.
    • Indirect RV and Marine accounts for 73% of its non-purchased loan growth mix in Q2, while community banking accounts for 17%.
    • Though the Real Estate Specialties Group only accounted for 17% of non-purchased loan growth in Q2, Bank of Ozarks says it expects RESG to continue to be its largest single contributor to non-purchased loan growth in most years.
    • Excluding purchased loans, ratio of nonperforming loans were 0.10% of total loans at Q2 end vs. 0.11% Y/Y. Nonperforming assets were 0.15% of total assets vs. 0.23% a year ago.
    • Allowance for loan losses for non-purchased loans was $103M, or 0.73% of total non-purchased loans vs. $80.7M, or 0.73%, Y/Y. Loan loss allowance for purchased loans was $1.6M, the same as a year ago.
    • Source: Press Release
    • Previously: Bank of the Ozarks EPS in-line, misses on revenue (July 11)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM | 20 Comments
  • ACRX

    AcelRx initiates equity offering; shares down 9% after hours

    • AcelRx Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ACRX) launches a public offering of common stock. Price, volume and terms have yet to be released.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM | 9 Comments
  • MYOV

    Myovant launches $75M equity offering

    • Myovant Sciences (NYSE:MYOV) commences a $75M public offering of common stock. Price, volume and terms have yet to be announced.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM
  • GPRO

    GoPro has sold over 30M Hero cameras

    • GoPro (NASDAQ:GPRO) announces that Hero camera sales have exceeded 30M units from the November 2009 launch to 2Q18.
    • The company has sold over 4M Hero5 Black cameras, which launched in 4Q16. 
    • GoPro shares are up 2.7% aftermarket to $6.40.  
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM | 11 Comments
  • AUPH

    Aurinia launches mid-stage study of voclosporin in dry eye syndrome; shares up 2% after hours

    • Aurinia Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:AUPH) initiates a Phase 2 clinical trial evaluating voclosporin ophthalmic solution (VOS) for the treatment of dry eye syndrome (DES). It will compare VOS 0.2% against Allergan's (NYSE:AGN) RESTASIS (cyclosporine ophthalmic emulsion 0.05%) over a four-week treatment period in 90 patients with mild-to-moderate DES.
    • The primary endpoint will be tolerability. Secondary endpoints include efficacy measures. The trial should be completed by year-end.
    • Shares are up 2% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM | 19 Comments
  • CA

    CA jumps 16% on report that Broadcom is close to $18B buyout

    • CA is up 16.1% after hours on a WSJ report that Broadcom (NASDAQ:AVGO) is close to a deal to acquire it for $44.50/share.
    • That's about an $18B deal and it could be announced as soon as today, sources told WSJ.
    • CA closed at $37.22 and is quoting at $43.22 postmarket.
    • AVGO finished down 2.8% today.
    • Updated 5:44 p.m.: AVGO is now down 5.8% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM | 38 Comments
  • LEDS

    SemiLEDs reports Q3 results

    • SemiLEDs (NASDAQ:LEDS): Q3 EPS of -$0.09
    • Revenue of $1.99M (-5.7% Y/Y)
    • Shares +16.11%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM
  • ANH

    Mortgage REITs manage gains in a nervous broader market.

    • While financial stocks suffer in today's down market, most mortgage REITs are seeing some gains, with Anworth Mortgage Asset (ANH +0.5%) and Orchid Island Capital (ORC +0.8%) among  the stronger in late afternoon trading.
    • The VanEck Vectors Mortgage REIT Income ETF (NYSEARCA:MORT) is up 0.2% in late trading.
    • Other mortgage REITS: Invesco Mortgage Capital (IVR +0.5%), CYS Investments (CYS +0.8%), Chimera Investment (CIM +0.6%), and Ellington Financial (EFC +0.7%).
    • ETFs: MORL, REM
     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM | 34 Comments
  • WLK

    Westlake Chemical -4.5% as Nomura Instinet downgrades

    • Westlake Chemical (WLK -4.6%) is downgraded to Neutral from Buy with a $120 price target, trimmed from $125, at Nomura Instinet, which sees WLK's risk/reward as more balanced given a more cautious outlook for U.S. caustic soda prices, especially in the near term.
    • The firm's Aleksey Yefremov sees more challenging outlooks for H2 2018 compared to H1 because of easing demand in certain commodities and materials, inflation in raw materials and other costs, and less favorable currency.
    • Yefremov likes DowDuPont (DWDP -2%) and FMC Corp. (FMC -2.5%) the most among his Buy-rated names in the Americas chemicals space.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM
  • NVS

    Novartis bails on early-stage antibiotic/antiviral research, 140 staff out

    • Endpoints' John Carroll reports that Novartis' (NVS -1.1%) innovation group, The Novartis Institutes for BioMedical Research (NIBR) has pulled the plug on antibacterial and antiviral research at its Emeryville, CA site citing higher priorities elsewhere. Preclinical programs will be axed in addition to clinical development of LYS228.
    • The move will trigger the layoff of ~140 employees.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM
  • XOM

    U.S. oil price plunges 5%, Brent -7% as Libyan production returns

    • U.S. WTI crude oil suffers its worst one-day loss since June 2017, settling -5% at $70.38/bbl, while Brent crude -6.9% to $73.40/bbl for its worst day in nearly two and a half years.
    • WTI momentarily rose after the U.S. reported domestic crude inventories fell a whopping 12.6M barrels last week, but the price buckled under the combined weight of Libya lifting a force majeure on four oil ports and indicating production would return to normal levels, OPEC reporting an increase in its June output in June, a stronger dollar, and concerns surrounding the economic impact of worsening U.S.-China trade tensions.
    • “We were ripe for a correction - here it is,” says John Saucer at Mobius Risk Group. “This is your classic long liquidation technical selloff.”
    • The S&P 500 energy sector (-2.3%) is today's worst performer, and individual stocks post broad declines: XOM -1.5%, CVX -3.2%, BP -4%, RDS.B -2.8%, COP -2.5%, APC -3.4%, SLB -1.7%, HAL -2.8%, BHGE -4.1%, MRO -3.5%, HES -4.5%, DVN -3.6%, APA -2.2%, CHK -5.1%, EOG -2%, PXD -4%, WLL -4.1%, RIG -3.6%, ESV -3.1%, NE -4.1%, DO -4.8%, RDC -3.6%.
    • ETFs: USO, XLE, OIL, UWT, UCO, VDE, XOP, DWT, ERX, OIH, SCO, BNO, DBO, ERY, DIG, BGR, GUSH, DTO, FENY, USL, IYE, DUG, DRIP, IEO, FIF, DNO, NDP, PXE, OLO, RYE, PXJ, SZO, CRAK, FXN, OLEM, WTIU, DDG, OILK, NANR, OILX, WTID, USOI, USOU, USOD, FTXN, JHME, UBRT, ERYY, DBRT, ERGF, OILD, OILU, USAI
     
     
     
     
    | 3:34 PM | 145 Comments
  • ORCL

    Pentagon says final proposals for cloud contract coming soon

    • The US Defense Department says a final request for cloud contract proposals is coming soon and that the Pentagon is conducting a full review of the project.
    • The comments come from the Pentagon’s new CIO, who stayed light on details.
    • The Pentagon originally planned to release the final call for proposals more than a month ago.
    • The multibillion-dollar, single-award contract has created some tech drama as cloud providers like Oracle (ORCL +1.1%), IBM (IBM +0.2%), and Microsoft (MSFT -0.1%) worry that Amazon (AMZN +0.5%) has the advantage of scale. 
    • Previously: Pentagon indefinitely delays cloud contract amid tech co. concerns (May 31)
    • Previously: Oracle CEO admits to cloud contract discussion with Trump (April 16)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:26 PM | 57 Comments
  • TORC

    ResTORbio's RTB101 shows treatment benefit in mid-stage study; shares up 9%

    • Thinly traded micro cap resTORbio (TORC +9.4%) is up on a 7x surge in volume in response to its announcement of positive results from a Phase 2a clinical trial assessing the infection-lowering ability of lead drug RTB101 in elderly patients. The data were published in the online edition of Science Translational Medicine. 
    • The study showed that treatment with RTB101, as monotherapy and in combination with Novartis' AFINITOR (everolimus), statistically significantly reduced the annualized rates of infections, 33% and 38%, respectively, compared to placebo. The annualized rates of respiratory tract infections were reduced by 42% and 38%, respectively, at year 1.
    • The combination of RTB101 and everolimus significantly enhanced the response to influenza vaccination and upregulated the expression of genes that play a key role in helping the immune system fight respiratory tract infections.
    • Topline data from a Phase 2b study should be available next quarter.
    • RTB101 inhibits a multiprotein complex called TORC1 involved in an intracellular signaling pathway called mTOR. The company says animal studies have shown that inhibiting TORC1 may prolong lifespan, enhance immune function, improve heart failure, enhance memory and mobility and delay the onset of age-related diseases.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM | 7 Comments
  • AAL

    Airline stocks in retreat after American guidance update

    • Airlines stocks trade lower after a drop in Q2 unit revenue guidance from American Airlines Group (AAL -7.6%) draws the attention of investors.
    • Notable decliners include United Continental (UAL -3.5%), Spirit Airlines (SAVE -3%), Delta Air Lines (DAL -1.4%), Alaska Air Group (AAL -7.6%), Allegiant Travel (ALGT -2.3%) and Hawaiian Holdings (HA -1.6%).
    • Previously: American Airlines -2% after Q2 update (July 11)
    • Related ETF: JETS.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:10 PM | 25 Comments
  • WOW

    Credit Suisse starts WideOpenWest at 4% downside

    • Credit Suisse starts WideOpenWest (NYSE:WOW) with a Neutral rating and $10.50 price target, a 4% downside to yesterday’s close.
    • WideOpenWest shares are down 2.8% to $10.66. 
     
     
     
     
    | 3:02 PM
  • AXTI

    Technology - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2.55 PM (07/11/2018)

    • Gainers: AXTI +15%. BBOX +12%. MOXC +10%. SHSP +8%. NCTY +8%.
    • Losers: BLIN -25%. SLP -21%. TDS -13%. SITO -13%. USM -13%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM
  • CRM

    Salesforce +1.8% on Oppenheimer target boost

    • Oppenheimer maintains an Outperform rating on Salesforce (NYSE:CRM) and raises the price target from $152 to $160, a 12% upside to yesterday’s close.  
    • Salesforce shares are up 1.8% to $144.94.  
     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM | 11 Comments
  • BA

    Boeing a Buy ahead of earnings report in two weeks, Baird analyst says

    • Boeing (BA -1.8%) is sharply lower today - not a surprise, since it is considered to be heavily exposed in a trade war with China - but Baird analyst Peter Arment thinks investors should buy the stock ahead of the company's July 25 earnings report.
    • Arment raises his Q2 earnings estimate by $0.03 to $3.50/share, a nickel ahead of consensus, citing his bullish view on 737 deliveries and the company's backlog, which stood at just under 6K aircraft at the end of the quarter.
    • Reiterating a Buy rating and $450 price target on the stock, Arment believes BA will record $13.4B in free cash flow for the year, rising to $14.3B in 2019 and $15.6B in 2020, given the ramp-up in deliveries, strong order demand and operational execution.
    • Credit Suisse's Robert Spingarn also offers positive commentary today; he's bullish on BA because of recently announced delivery data, and says investors can "expect continued operational excellence to drive another solid quarter" in the company's core earnings and cash flow.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM | 10 Comments
  • CRK

    Comstock Resources +8% after winning new $700M credit facility

    • Comstock Resources (CRK +8.4%) surges as much as 11% to a 52-week high after it secures commitments from a syndicate of 13 banks for a new five-year revolving credit facility with a $700M borrowing base.
    • The facility will become effective upon the closing of the contribution of certain oil and gas assets by entities owned by Jerry Jones and his family.
    • CRK shareholders will vote at next month's annual meeting on the issuance of shares in connection with the Jones contribution.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:34 PM
  • FIT

    SEC expands charges in 2016 Fitbit manipulation scheme

    • The SEC has expanded a complaint into a scheme to manipulate stock in Fitbit (FIT -4.4%) through false filings.
    • The agency filed fraud charges against a second defendant, Mark Burns, saying he bought call options in Fitbit just before he and co-conspirator Robert Murray filed a fake tender offer on EDGAR purporting to acquire company shares at a big premium.
    • That offer was made Nov. 10, 2016, in the name of ABM Capital, what the SEC says is a fake company for which the two created an EDGAR account. Shares temporarily spiked as a result.
    • Burns sold his options for a 350% gain (about $13,000) accordingly, the SEC says.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:30 PM | 19 Comments
  • WMLP-OLD

    Energy/Materials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 PM (07/11/2018)

    • Gainers: WMLP-OLD +16%. CRK +8%. TGA +6%. GNE +5%.
    • Losers: USAU -16%. GBR -16%. PED -13%. SNES -10%. NOG -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM | 5 Comments
  • PZZA

    Papa John's -3% after founder generates negative news again

    • Shares of Papa John's International (NASDAQ:PZZA) are down after Fortune reports on a conference call practice run by CEO John Schnatter in which participants allege that he used a racial slur and made offensive statements.
    • Fortune says Papa John's sent a statement that did not dispute any of its reporting, but noted that the company condemns racism and any insensitive language in any setting.
    • Schnatter has been less prominent in Papa John's advertising since he blamed part of the pizza operator's sales issues on the NFL last year.
    • PZZA is 2.61% lower on the day and is 12% down YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:45 PM | 3 Comments
  • ZTCOF

    U.S., ZTE reach deal for $400M escrow in move toward lifting ban

    • The United States has come to an escrow deal with ZTE (ZTCOF -3.9%) that will pave the way toward the company's fully resuming operations.
    • The banned Chinese telecom equipment provider needs to put $400M into escrow before its ban can be lifted, the Commerce Dept. says, after which it will issue a notice lifting a denial order.
    • That will leave a compliance regime in place made up of the denial order (a 10-year order that would be suspended with the escrow), the escrow funds, and a monitor to be selected.
    • Moving to session highs are Acacia Communications (ACIA +0.8%) and Oclaro (OCLR -1.2%).
     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM | 2 Comments
  • DIS

    Disney, Blizzard enter live esports deal for 'Overwatch'

    • Walt Disney (DIS +1.7%) networks have entered an exclusive deal for live broadcasts of Blizzard's (ATVI +2.4%) Overwatch League, providing the next milestone in comprehensive esports coverage.
    • ESPN and Disney XD will broadcast coverage, which will begin with playoff coverage today on both networks and include the Grand Finals July 27-28. A recap show with highlights will air on ABC July 29.
    • The coverage will also be streamed live on the ESPN App and DisneyNOW.
    • It's the first broadcast of an esports championship on ABC.
    • Previously: Goldman praises mobile prospects for Activision Blizzard (Jul. 11 2018)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:38 PM | 26 Comments
  • CCOI

    Cogent Comms hits month's low on DB Sell rating

    • Cogent Communications (NASDAQ:CCOI) is now off 5.6% and at its lowest point in over a month after Deutsche Bank put it on the short-term sell list with earnings coming up.
    • That report, due before the open on Aug. 2, will likely "re-focus the spotlight on fundamentals" that don't back up peak valuation, says analyst Matthew Niknam. In fact, valuation looked full after Q1 results, and shares have climbed another 6.5% in the weeks since. (h/t Bloomberg)
    • Expansion and shareholder payments have been consistent but not beats, he says.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:07 PM
  • TREE

    Financials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM (07/11/2018)

    • Gainers: TREE +8%.
    • Losers: FPI -33%. SAR -8%. PMTS -7%. JP -6%. CIFS -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • BA

    Boeing delays may cut off U.S. astronauts from space station, GAO reports

    • NASA likely will further delay its program to send U.S. astronauts to the International Space Station using capsules developed by Boeing (BA -1.8%) and SpaceX, says a report from the U.S. Government Accountability Office.
    • "Additional delays could result in a gap in U.S. access to the space station as NASA has contracted for seats on the Russian Soyuz spacecraft only through November 2019," according to the the report, adding that NASA "does not have a contingency plan for ensuring uninterrupted U.S. access."
    • Further slips would push back already delayed certification milestones for each program, which were expected by December 2019 for Boeing and January 2020 for SpaceX.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM | 4 Comments
  • MDGS

    Midday Gainers / Losers (07/11/2018)

    • Gainers: MDGS +79%. MYOS +42%. BIOC +28%. ACHV +24%. TKAT +18%. ACIU +15%. MYGN +15%. WMLP-OLD +14%. MTSL +14%. INTX +13%.
    • Losers: FPI -31%. BLIN -21%. SLP -21%. OTC:RSLS -19%. GBR -17%. IDRA -17%. SLS -15%. STAF -14%. ANGO -14%. NFEC -13%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM | 4 Comments
  • RH

    Escalating tariffs roil furniture sector

    • The furniture and home furnishing sectors are being hit hard over tariff concerns. Goldman Sachs warns that some higher costs may not be easily passed on to consumers by specialty retailers.
    • Restoration Hardware (RH -5.7%), Williams-Sonoma (WSM -3.1%), Michaels Companies (MIK -3.1%), Pier 1 Imports (PIR -1.7%), The Container Store (TCS -1.4%), Bed Bath & Beyond (BBBY -2.5%), Kirkland's (KIRK -1.9%) and Haverty Furniture (HVT -1.8%) all trade lower on the day.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM | 3 Comments
  • AIR

    AAR Corp. -9% after earnings, but Canaccord sees buying opportunity

    • AAR Corp. (AIR -9%) tumbles from recent 52-week highs after reporting mixed Q2 results that saw earnings beat Wall Street estimates while revenues rose 5% Y/Y but fell short of expectations.
    • AAR also reaffirmed FY 2019 guidance, seeing EPS of $2.50-$2.80 vs. $2.71 analyst consensus estimate, revenues of $2.1B-$2.2B vs. $2.14B consensus, and adjusted EBITDA of $180M-$190M.
    • Canaccord Genuity maintains its bullish thesis on AAR and believes pressure on the stock is a buying opportunity, seeing upside in both the aviation services and expeditionary services segments, Briefing.com reports.
    • The firm says it remains as confident in FY 2019 as it was before the Q4 results and believes investor confidence could be improved by incrementally more disclosure and candor in quarterly results.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM
  • FOX

    Report: Sinclair Broadcast readying streaming service

    • Sinclair Broadcast Group (SBGI +2.3%) -- the local broadcast station owner often compared to Fox News for its conservative lean -- is planning a streaming service that could be a Fox News rival, BuzzFeed says.
    • The company will launch STIRR via free streaming and offer local news and national programming around the clock, according to the report.
    • It would also have other live and on-demand programs.
    • Fox News (FOX -4.1%, FOXA -3.9%), for its part, is also reportedly planning its own streaming offering based on its Fox Nation brand; it's also expected to appear before the end of the year.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:15 PM
  • SEED

    Consumer - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 PM (07/11/2018)

    • Gainers: SEED +7%. FTFT +5%.
    • Losers: VNCE -11%. DOGZ -9%. HOME -9%. FOSL -7%. AKO-B -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM
  • USM

    U.S. Cellular, TDS tumble as JPMorgan bears up

    • U.S. Cellular (NYSE:USM) is on a steady slide, down 12%, as JPMorgan becomes the first to make a Sell call on the stock.
    • The bank has downgraded shares to Underweight; it's given a similar downgrade to U.S. Cellular's parent company, Telephone & Data Systems (TDS -12.2%).
    • The company's business is tracking in line, says analyst Philip Cusick, but "the bigger question is the strategic value of USM in a world that will be increasingly focused on 5G services over time." The stock could outperform if churn and margin rebound faster than expected, but M&A is unlikely as the controlling family isn't interested, and prefers investment to paying shareholders. (h/t Bloomberg)
    • His price target on USM is $40 vs. current price of $34.83; He has a price target on TDS of $30, vs. current price of $25.47.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM | 2 Comments
  • BIOC

    Biocept tries to break downtrend, up 27%

    • Ultra-thinly traded micro cap Biocept (BIOC +26.9%) is up on a whopping 195x surge in volume as shares try to break an intermediate downtrend that began about a month ago. The stock has been mired in a long-term downtrend that began about 18 months ago, however.
    • Today, the company announced that investors need to purchase common shares by Thursday, July 19 in order to be considered shareholders of record on Monday, July 23, a qualification for its previously announced rights offering.
    • Shareholders of record will receive one non-transferable subscription right for each common share owned. Each right entitles the holder to purchase one unit at $1,000 per unit. Each unit will consist of one share of Series A Convertible Preferred Stock valued at $1,000 (immediately convertible into common shares at $4.53) and 220 five-year warrants to purchase common shares at $4.53.
    • Subscription rights may be exercised from Tuesday, July 24 until 5:00 pm ET on Wednesday, August 8, unless extended by the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM | 7 Comments
  • BABA

    US-listed Chinese tech stocks pressured by tariffs

    • US-listed Chinese tech stocks are feeling the pressure of the White House’s planned 10% tariffs on a further $200B in Chinese goods.
    • Movers include Alibaba (BABA -2.2%), Iqiyi (IQ -0.7%), Weibo (WB -2.5%), JD.com (JD -1.6%), 58.com (WUBA -1.1%), YY (YY -0.3%), Sogou (SOGO -1.6%).  
    • Previously: White House tariff plans send semi stocks sliding (July 11)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM | 64 Comments
  • SLP

    Simulations Plus down 21% after FQ3 results and bearish SA article

    • Thinly traded micro cap Simulations Plus (SLP -21.2%) slumps on more than triple normal volume, albeit on turnover of only 210K shares, after posting fiscal Q3 results after the close yesterday.
    • Revenues were up almost 27% to $8.6M and net income was up almost 64% to $7.6M.

  • DISH

    FCC presses Dish Network on wireless buildout delays

    • A letter from the FCC shows that Dish Network (DISH -2.1%) has missed milestone deadlines to build out a network based on a hoard of wireless spectrum, and as a result will face sooner deadlines to have the system ready.
    • Missing interim deadlines last year on the company's AWS-4 licenses and 700 MHz Lower E Block licenses means Dish will now need to offer signal coverage and service to 70% of the population of each license's service area (or 70% of the geographic area in the 700 MHz licenses' case) by March 7, 2020.
    • Then in May, Dish said it hadn't met interim deadlines for buildout of H Block licenses; its final construction deadline on those was accelerated by two years, to April 29, 2022.
    • Failing to meet the deadline on license areas will result in automatic license termination, or in the case of the 700 MHz licenses, unserved areas will be returned to the FCC for relicensing.
    • The FCC is seeking many more details from Dish on how it plans to build out the licenses.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM | 8 Comments

    Metals whacked on worries more U.S. tariffs on China could dent demand

    • Metals prices plunge on worries that Pres. Trump’s threat of another $200B in tariffs on Chinese goods, if enacted, would hit global demand.
    • Copper, already down nearly 15% since early June, recently was -2.9% to $6,162.50/metric ton in London, and zinc, nickel, lead and tin all are down more than 2%; agricultural commodities such as corn, cotton and coffee also are selling off.
    • “We’ll see those prices inflate the cost on the consumer level, leading to slowing demand and knocking commodities prices," says BMO Capital's Kash Kamal.
